title: How to Create a Bug Out Bag

steps.headline: Get a good durable bag.
steps.description: Preferably a M.O.L.L.E pack or another good outdoor backpack that isn't brightly-colored. It needs to be earth tones.

steps.headline: Buy a good medical kit.
steps.description: You should also pack some large triangle bandages and gauze pads. Add a bottle of Tylenol/Aspirin, some anti-diarrhea tablets, some sort of re-hydrating powder (Gatorade or the like), toothbrushes and toothpaste.

steps.headline: Create a tool kit.
steps.description: Have in your tool kit: wire cutters, 50 yards (45.7 m) of 550 parachute cord, a machete, wire, a small hammer, a collapsible shovel, screwdrivers, a fixed blade knife, ammunition, a sharpening stone, flint+steel, etc.

steps.headline: Have changes of clothing for everybody who goes to the location.
steps.description: 3 pairs of underwear, 7 pairs of socks, 2 pairs of pants (not blue jeans), army field jacket, combat boots, 3 web belts and 5 olive drab T-shirts, watch.

steps.headline: Be sure you have weapons.
steps.description: A .45 semi-automatic strapped to your leg/belt, AR type rifle slung on your shoulder, a multi-tool (such as a Leatherman) on your belt and a boot knife.

steps.headline: Provide enough water for everybody in the "party".
steps.description: 6 liters (1.6 US gal) of water, a canteen, and a few extra bottles on outside of your pack.

steps.headline: Consider other optional items.
steps.description: These include: water purifying tablets or filters, a compass, maps, a beanie hat, poncho, tarp, binoculars, jumper cables, M.R.E.s (Meals Ready to Eat), flashlights and lanterns, extra batteries, walkie-talkies, important papers and identification (birth certificate, drivers license etc. ), camouflage netting, flares, tripwire booby traps, a gas stove, pots and pans, and tarps.

text: Get a good durable bag. Preferably a M.O.L.L.E pack or another good outdoor backpack that isn't brightly-colored. It needs to be earth tones. Buy a good medical kit. You should also pack some large triangle bandages and gauze pads. Add a bottle of Tylenol/Aspirin, some anti-diarrhea tablets, some sort of re-hydrating powder (Gatorade or the like), toothbrushes and toothpaste. Create a tool kit. Have in your tool kit: wire cutters, 50 yards (45.7 m) of 550 parachute cord, a machete, wire, a small hammer, a collapsible shovel, screwdrivers, a fixed blade knife, ammunition, a sharpening stone, flint+steel, etc. Have changes of clothing for everybody who goes to the location. 3 pairs of underwear, 7 pairs of socks, 2 pairs of pants (not blue jeans), army field jacket, combat boots, 3 web belts and 5 olive drab T-shirts, watch. Be sure you have weapons. A .45 semi-automatic strapped to your leg/belt, AR type rifle slung on your shoulder, a multi-tool (such as a Leatherman) on your belt and a boot knife. Provide enough water for everybody in the "party". 6 liters (1.6 US gal) of water, a canteen, and a few extra bottles on outside of your pack. Consider other optional items. These include: water purifying tablets or filters, a compass, maps, a beanie hat, poncho, tarp, binoculars, jumper cables, M.R.E.s (Meals Ready to Eat), flashlights and lanterns, extra batteries, walkie-talkies, important papers and identification (birth certificate, drivers license etc. ), camouflage netting, flares, tripwire booby traps, a gas stove, pots and pans, and tarps.
